instruction: Find an online article to support the point that eating polyphenol-rich food can help reduce inflammation.
output: The article "The Power of Polyphenols in Fighting Chronic Inflammation" from Harvard Medical School provides evidence that polyphenols, found in many fruits and vegetables, have anti-inflammatory effects. The article cites a number of scientific studies that demonstrate how polyphenols can reduce inflammation, and how it can improve health outcomes for numerous sufferers of chronic inflammatory diseases.
